content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```
function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    # Use regular expressions to match all code blocks in the Markdown document
    code_blocks = eachmatch(r"^```\w*\n?", md)

    # Join all the code blocks together with a newline character
    return join(code_blocks, "\n")
end
```
This function uses regular expressions to match all code blocks in the Markdown document. It then joins all the code blocks together with a newline character. The `eachmatch` function is used to iterate over all the matches and the `join` function is used to concatenate them into a single string.
